title: Many gather to honor first victim of Sydney Hanukkah attack

Australian officials say the suspects were motivated by ISIS. It suggests the group may still have the ability to inspire acts of terrorism.
At least 15 people were killed when gunmen opened fire at a Hanukkah event at Bondi Beach, marking Australia’s deadliest attack in nearly three decades.

The attack is Australia's deadliest in nearly 30 years. Funerals for the other victims are being planned.

title: New York Knicks win 2025 NBA Cup against San Antonio Spurs
snippets: New York Knicks end their more-than-half-a-century trophy drought in the NBA with a victory over the San Antonio Spurs.
OG Anunoby scores 28 points as the New York Knicks end their 52-year trophy drought by beating the San Antonio Spurs in the NBA Cup final.
Here are the key highlights from New York's victory over San Antonio to win the 2025 NBA Cup.

O.G. Anunoby had 28 points and nine rebounds while Jalen Brunson contributed 24 points and eight assists to lead the New York Knicks to a 124-113 victory over the San Antonio Spurs to win the NBA Cup in Las Vegas.
Leaning on their trademark uber-physical style, the Knicks proved that they are a legitimate contender with Tuesday’s NBA Cup-clinching win over the Spurs.

summary: The New York Knicks won the 2025 NBA Cup, defeating the San Antonio Spurs 124-113 in Las Vegas. OG Anunoby led the Knicks with 28 points and nine rebounds, while Jalen Brunson added 24 points and eight assists. This victory ends the Knicks' 52-year trophy drought.

title: FIFA will sell some $60 tickets for 2026 World Cup games
snippets: The good news? FIFA responded to outrage at the most expensive World Cup ever with discount tickets comparable to the cost of a normal game for "loyal fans." The bad news? It's for a tiny share of the tickets.
FIFA said it would sell $60 tickets to the World Cup, including for the final — but only for supporters of qualified teams. And the actual number of available tickets is limited.
Ticket prices have increased astronomically on the resale market. FIFA will allow each country to decide how to allocate the cheaper tickets to “loyal” fans.

GENEVA — FIFA slashed the price of some World Cup tickets for teams’ most loyal fans following a global backlash and some will get US$60 seats for the final instead of being asked to pay $4,185. It was a rare climbdown by the soccer body and its president Gianni Infantino after soaking up waves of criticism for World Cup strategies, including top-dollar prices and closer political alignment with U.S. President Donald Trump. FIFA said Tuesday that $60 tickets will be made available for every game at the tournament in North America, going to the national federations whose teams are playing....

These discounted tickets are only available to supporters of qualified teams, with each national federation deciding how to distribute them. Most tickets remain expensive, and resale prices are high.
